title: If I write a book can I use parts of music inside of it? - Quora

response.answer_text: No more so than a songwriter could make lyrics from your prose. Song titles are okay if not so famous there’s no mistaking them for anything else. The Can I Use Song Lyrics in my Manuscript? | WritersDigest.com gives a fairly clear explanation or as clear as can be if there is no specific law against taking a snatch of song lyrics without any attempt to pretend it’s your own work. You’re better off making up your own, e.g., Your family lives in a purple underwater marine vehicle. Not so catchy as the original.

Yes you can relate how that music made you get an idea, or a picture of what you are writing, it can act as an inspiration of your content. Theme will catch itself, you can write about what inspires your thoughts, but definetly, you cant copy others stuff directly or indirectly. If its about parts of music of your own you can share music sheets or written music to let other people play and experience the frequencies. That can increase interactive source of your content. I hope I got to answer about what you tried to question.
